newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Mabuhay Vinyl 1996 net at 94.8 mln pesos.
newsitem.headline: Mabuhay Vinyl 1996 net at 94.8 mln pesos.

text.p: Philippine petrochemicals firm Mabuhay Vinyl Corp said on Wednesday its unaudited net income in 1996 reached 94.8 million pesos, up from 84 million pesos in 1995.
Edwin Umali, the company's executive vice president, also said net profit was seen rising further to 124 million pesos in 1997 on the back of higher sales.
The company's initial public offering of shares was listed on the Philippine Stock Exchange on Wednesday.
It opened at 2.18 pesos, up from its offer price of 1.90 pesos, but fell back in early trade to 2.06 pesos.
The company offered 223.187 million shares to the public, which amounts to 33.97 percent of the expanded capital.
Mabuhay's opening price was at a price-earnings multiple of 10.9 times 1997 forecast earnings per share of 20 centavos.
Mabuhay Vinyl is a producer of polyvinyl chloride (PVC) resin used in the manufacture of pipes and tiles.

It will use the proceeds of the IPO to fund its 49 percent equity investment in Philippine Resins Industries Inc, a 70,000-tonne PVC resin plant in a joint venture with Mitsubishi Corp and Tosoh Corp and Bank of the Philippine Islands.

Major stockholders of Mabuhay Vinyl are Bank of Philippine Islands which has a 22.5 percent stake; Maria Christina Chemicals Industries Corp, 19.8 percent; Asian Investment Co Ltd, 8.5 percent; Eastside Philippines Co Inc, 6.3 percent, Mitsubishi Corp, 2.2 percent; and others, 6.8 percent.
